doc:
Bourvil https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bourvil 0 André Bourvil, born André Robert Raimbourg (French pronunciation: ​[ɑ̃dʁe buʁˈvil]; 27 July 1917, Prétot-Vicquemare, France – 23 September 1970, Paris), often known mononymously as Bourvil, was a French actor and singer best known for his roles in comedy films, most notably in his collaboration with Louis de Funès in the films Le Corniaud (1965) and La Grande Vadrouille (1966). For his performance in Le Corniaud, he won a Special Diploma at the 4th Moscow International Film Festival. André_Bourvil , born André_Robert_Raimbourg ( French_pronunciation : [_ɑ̃dʁe buʁˈvil_] ; 27_July_1917 , Prétot-Vicquemare , France – 23_September_1970 , Paris ) , often known mononymously as Bourvil , was a_French_actor_and_singer best_known for his_roles in comedy_films , most_notably in his_collaboration with Louis de Funès in the_films_Le_Corniaud ( 1965 ) and La_Grande_Vadrouille ( 1966 ) . For his_performance in Le_Corniaud , he won a_Special_Diploma at the_4th_Moscow_International_Film_Festival .
